questions.question: If in Lassaigne’s test, Silver nitrate reacts with Lassaigne’s extract to give white precipitate that is soluble in Ammonium hydroxide, it indicates the presence of

explanations.a: Iodine gives a yellow precipitate that is insoluble in NH₄OH.
explanations.b: Bromine gives a pale yellow precipitate, sparingly soluble in NH₄OH.
explanations.c: Chlorine gives a white precipitate soluble in NH₄OH. Reference
explanations.d: Fluorine does not form AgF precipitate under normal conditions.

questions.question: The ionic compound formed during the fusion of 1,2-Dichloro benzene with sodium metal is

explanations.a: Chlorine reacts with sodium to form NaCl during fusion.
explanations.b: Na₂S is formed when sulfur is present.
explanations.c: NaCN is formed when nitrogen and carbon are present.
explanations.d: AgCl is a silver salt formed in detection, not during fusion.

questions.question: The element which cannot be detected through Lassaigne’s test is

explanations.a: Sulfur forms Na₂S and can be detected with nitroprusside.
explanations.b: Chlorine forms NaCl and can be detected with AgNO₃.
explanations.c: Oxygen does not form a detectable ionic compound with sodium.
explanations.d: Nitrogen forms NaCN and is detected with FeSO₄.
